meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the direct opposite of someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero was the antitheses of the villain, always fighting for justice.
meanings.sent2: The concept of good is often seen as the antitheses of evil in many fairy tales.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog were the antitheses of each other, but they still managed to become best friends.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality was the antitheses of his gloomy demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The bright, sunny day was the perfect antitheses to the stormy night before.

meanings.sent1: The black cat was the antitheses of the white cat in the litter.
meanings.sent2: His actions were the antitheses of his words, causing confusion among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The silence in the room was the antitheses of the loud music playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The calm lake was the antitheses of the raging river nearby.
meanings.sent5: The cold winter weather was the antitheses of the hot summer days.
